posts.post_content: Vigilance doesn't mean that the creature can't tap; it just means that attacking doesn't cause it to tap. Which would make this card even better, since she could attack without tapping, and then also use her ability.
posts.html:

Posted By: sonorhC (11/4/2011 11:18:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Avatar of Woe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avatar of Woe), meet Visara. Visara, Woe. I hope you two can get along, all right?  
  
Personally, i think they are both equal. See, Avatar has that Threshold-esque ability which makes it a little bit cheaper when the going gets tough.   
  
Visara has Flying, but the Avatar has Fear. This can be tricky if you're playing against black/artifacts... but then again, it seems like at least 10% of all creatures have flying or reach. (Please don't correct me, i know it's not that percentage)  
  
All-in-all, i think Avatar is better, now that i think of it. However, it isn't legendary... which could also backfire if you have (for some reason) two Visara's.
posts.html:
Avatar of Woe, meet Visara. Visara, Woe. I hope you two can get along, all right?

Personally, i think they are both equal. See, Avatar has that Threshold-esque ability which makes it a little bit cheaper when the going gets tough.

Visara has Flying, but the Avatar has Fear. This can be tricky if you're playing against black/artifacts... but then again, it seems like at least 10% of all creatures have flying or reach. (Please don't correct me, i know it's not that percentage)

All-in-all, i think Avatar is better, now that i think of it. However, it isn't legendary... which could also backfire if you have (for some reason) two Visara's.

Just be glad this wasn't the 5th Alara legend in the set. I mean seriously, almost a third of the vault was Alara block... and 2 from Zendikar, which is still in Standard!
